/Users/delphine/Development/SVN/emeraldion.it/zelda/node_modules/gulp-sass/node_modules/node-sass/node_modules/node-gyp/src/win_delay_load_hook.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * When this file is linked to a DLL, it sets up a delay-load hook that
00003  * intervenes when the DLL is trying to load 'node.exe' or 'iojs.exe'
00004  * dynamically. Instead of trying to locate the .exe file it'll just return
00005  * a handle to the process image.
00006  *
00007  * This allows compiled addons to work when node.exe or iojs.exe is renamed.
00008  */
00009 
00010 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00011 
00012 #define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
00013 #include <windows.h>
00014 
00015 #include <delayimp.h>
00016 #include <string.h>
00017 
00018 static FARPROC WINAPI load_exe_hook(unsigned int event, DelayLoadInfo* info) {
00019   HMODULE m;
00020   if (event != dliNotePreLoadLibrary)
00021     return NULL;
00022 
00023   if (_stricmp(info->szDll, "iojs.exe") != 0 &&
00024       _stricmp(info->szDll, "node.exe") != 0)
00025     return NULL;
00026 
00027   m = GetModuleHandle(NULL);
00028   return (FARPROC) m;
00029 }
00030 
00031 PfnDliHook __pfnDliNotifyHook2 = load_exe_hook;
00032 
00033 #endif
